javax.activity
Interface ServiceManager

public interface ServiceManager

A ServiceManager is an entity that is provided by a UOW service built on top of the Activity service that defines how the UOW service's Activities should be managed. In particular, it defines which PropertyGroups the UOW service uses, which ContextGroup the UOW service participates in, and the CompletionSignalSet that is used to complete the UOW services's Activities.
The Activity service uses the properties of the ServiceManager when it creates and operates on Activities specific to that service.

Method Summary
 int getActivityType()
          Returns the type of the Activities that are created for this UOW service.

Method Detail

getContextGroup

public java.lang.String getContextGroup()
Returns the ContextGroup name that the UOW service belongs to. This name is a String that different UOW services use to identify a group to which their contexts belong. By convention, a UOW servcie that does not intend its context to be managed cooperatively with transactions or another Activity-based UOW service should use a ContextGroup name that is the same as the package name of the UOW service itself.
Returns:
The name of the ContextGroup that the UOW service belongs to. If no ContextGroup has been specified then this method returns null and the UOW service's contexts belong to the default context group.

getPropertyGroup

public java.lang.String[] getPropertyGroup()
Returns the array of PropertyGroup names that are used by the UOW service.
Each time an Activity for this UOW service is started, an instance of each PropertyGroup in the list is started and associated with the Activity.
Returns:
An array of PropertyGroup names that are used by the UOW service. If no PropertyGroups have been specified then this method returns null.

getCompletionSignalSetName

public java.lang.String getCompletionSignalSetName()
Returns the name of the SignalSet, if any, that will be used for the distribution of completion signals when the current Activity completes.
Returns:
The name of the SignalSet that will be used for the distribution of completion signals when the current Activity completes. If no CompletionSignalSet has been set then null is returned.

getSignalSet

public SignalSet getSignalSet(java.lang.String SignalSetName)
                       throws SignalSetUnknownException,
                              NoImplementException
Creates a new instance of the named SignalSet, and returns a reference to it.
In some execution environments, such as a J2EE client, this method need not be implemented and calling it may result in a NoImplementationException.
Returns:
A SignalSet instance.
Throws:
SignalSetUnknownException - Thrown if the named SignalSet is not recognized by the ServiceManager.
NoImplementException - Thrown if the Activity service does not provide an implementation of this method in the calling environment, for example if a J2EE client calls this method.

getActivityType

public int getActivityType()
Returns the type of the Activities that are created for this UOW service. The type is propagated in the ActivityIdentity part of the Activity context.
Returns:
The type value that will be set into the omg.org.CosActivity.ActivityIdentity for Activities created on behalf of this UOW service.

usesChildLifetmeSignalSet

public boolean usesChildLifetmeSignalSet()
Returns a boolean to indicate whether or not the ChildLifetime system SignalSet is used by the UOW service. An Activity service implementation may optimise its behaviour by not using the ChildLifetime SignalSet if the UOW service has indicated it does not use this SignalSet.
Returns:
A boolean to indicate whether or not the UOW service represented by the ServiceManager uses the ChildLifetime system SignalSet. A value of true indicates that the UOW service does use this SignalSet.
